summary: "The Fountainhead" is a 1943 novel by Ayn Rand about Howard Roark, an architect who fights against traditional standards and values individualism. Roark faces opposition from people who prefer conformity, including his former classmate Peter Keating and critic Ellsworth Toohey. The novel also features Dominique Francon, Roark's complex lover. Initially rejected by publishers, "The Fountainhead" became a bestseller and has sold over 10 million copies worldwide. It has been adapted into a film and a stage play, and continues to influence architects, entrepreneurs, and political conservatives.
title: The Fountainhead
